channel.title: World war 3
channel.description: Who thinks a new large if not world war 3 is comming up? Personally I think it will happen

item.title: World war 3
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“pk3r john, post:91, topic:264299”][quote author=skiller noob1 link=topic=349032.msg2854243#msg2854243 date=1246735777]
I know the War is coming, we’re waiting for North Korea to hit something of ours so we can rip them a new asshole.

Then, we live with a cloud of radiation above us for a long time, then we start life over again.
[/quote]

They failed. Read my post in the news section.

I hope WW3 doesn’t come, but if it does, I WILL SNIPE OUT MY WINDOW :P[/quote]
I have a feeling WWIII would be a little bit more serious than ‘sniping out of a window’. WWIII will never happen, there will always be sieges, peace-keeping invasions (kind of ironic isn’t it) and stuff like that. If there is ever a threat for WWIII to be declared, it will turn out like the Cold War because it just simply cannot happen. Nuclear warfare will prevent it, now that everyone has their hands on some form of nucleated device.

Read full topic

item.title: World war 3
item.dc:creator: @Square Square
item.description:
@Square wrote:

[quote=“jensie, post:88, topic:264299”][quote author=Square link=topic=349032.msg2826139#msg2826139 date=1245006274]

Ya, I thought so. and I absolutely love this quote.

“I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.”
—Albert Einstein

It’s a false quote. I doubt humans will lose their knowledge to make bows and similar weapons. A technological setback to let’s say the dark ages means that transport will be set back to the dark ages too. So there is no way there’ll be a world war under those circumstances.
[/quote]You’re completely missing the concept. It’s not literal at all, that’s why it’s a great quote. It’s philosophically correct.

How could anything be philosophically correct?
Since philosophy is the eternal search to knowledge… :p[/quote]True.

Read full topic

item.title: World war 3
item.dc:creator: @jensie jensie
item.description:
@jensie wrote:

[quote=“Square, post:84, topic:264299”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=349032.msg2826131#msg2826131 date=1245005954]

Ya, I thought so. and I absolutely love this quote.

“I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.”
—Albert Einstein

It’s a false quote. I doubt humans will lose their knowledge to make bows and similar weapons. A technological setback to let’s say the dark ages means that transport will be set back to the dark ages too. So there is no way there’ll be a world war under those circumstances.
[/quote]You’re completely missing the concept. It’s not literal at all, that’s why it’s a great quote. It’s philosophically correct.[/quote]
How could anything be philosophically correct?
Since philosophy is the eternal search to knowledge…

Read full topic

item.title: World war 3
item.dc:creator: @Square Square
item.description:
@Square wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:86, topic:264299”][quote author=Square link=topic=349032.msg2826139#msg2826139 date=1245006274]
You’re completely missing the concept. It’s not literal at all, that’s why it’s a great quote. It’s philosophically correct.
[/quote]

That’s exactly what I mean. Quite a lot of people I’ve been talking to quote Einstein, and say it in such a context that it becomes obvious they mean it literally.

It’s just like the quote from Einstein about god. A lot of Christians think that Einstein believed in their god, but he meant god in a non-literal way.[/quote]Understandable. Although, “Don’t assume the obvious, because obvious can be deceiving.” - Square ;]

Read full topic

item.title: World war 3
item.dc:creator: @Lil_Goon Lil Goon
item.description:
@Lil_Goon wrote:

[quote=“Square, post:81, topic:264299”][quote author=Lil Goon link=topic=349032.msg2825640#msg2825640 date=1244959011]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=349032.msg2685838#msg2685838 date=1235674961]

I’m from UK, so from an outsiders point of view, I would definitely not want to be American.

How quickly it is forgotten that if it wasn’t for these Americans you would be speaking German right now, or simply not exist.
[/quote]If I can remember correctly France had a major part in helping. But they don’t get enough credit from it.
[/quote]You’re right, I remember my WH teacher telling me about it.

As to the OP, as long as there’s a world, we’ll have war; put two and two together.[/quote]Ya, I thought so. and I absolutely love this quote.

[quote=“lordbost, post:15, topic:264299”]“I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.”
—Albert Einstein[/quote]

item.title: World war 3
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:76, topic:264299”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=349032.msg2767533#msg2767533 date=1240907367]
the economic downturn certainly makes a third world war more likely as everyone is trying to get money, if it gets really bad UK will probably get all its colonies together and try and take over the world again
[/quote]

And fail miserably… our bloody Queen is pointless! What we need is a young prince to step up, take the crown, destroy the parliament (bunch of money theiving twats) and take back the British Empire (Including America). Then we can all devolve into pirates and go to Somalia and take back the ships of the world and become legends of the high seas. I myself will most probably be a captain as I’m so fricken ownage and everyone else can be my crew members. Then we will plunder places like France and spit at the Chinese… and shit.[/quote]
i like your way of thinking

Read full topic

T4_, you should go send yourself $20.00 USD and see how fast it comes back.

item.title: World war 3
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Yea probably…

This economic downturn won’t lead to anything war related. It’s the oil under the North pole that can cause some trouble in the near future. Canada, Scandinavian countries and Russia all want it. And for some reason the US think they have some rights there too, but I don’t know why they think that.
